intro: Euphrasia microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and grasslands. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the spring, and it produces tiny, capsule-like fruits. Euphrasia microcarpa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
